Scenario Selction

Configuration of the Scenario list, which is needed for the Change Scenario command in the SCP Command channel. If the user wants to change a scenario, he needs to add the scenario to this list before deployment.Sending the custom command is a two step process. First set the Scenario Selection channel to the desired ID, then set the SCP Command to value 6, this will send the custom command to VIRES VTD.

What do you want to do?

Scenario List Configuration

Scenario List stores user-defined SCP commands which could be selected via this channel. The Scenario ID is used on the running system for scenario selection through the Scenario Selection command (value 6) of the SCP Command channel. To add a custom SCP command to this list, you need to right-click on the list and select "Add". Then add the absolute path to the scenario XML. An example string could look like: "/home/philip/Vires21/VTD.2.1/Data/Projects/SampleProject/Scenarios/traffic_demo.xml" If the user enters a value higher than ID availabe the system will choose the set default value and give out error -1203 in the SCP last error channel.

Note  Use right-click context menu to add or remove Scenario List items. Use up and down buttons to change scenario order (aka scenario ID).You can also import and export a scenario list to/from CSV, with the buttons on the top.
